body_html:
Which OS version and glibc version are you using? Based the answers to a similar stackoverflow question, my guess is that you have a glibc version earlier than 2.17, which is needed for the binary distribution to work.

The easiest workaround may be to install a Docker container containing TensorFlow, by following the instructions here.
body_text:
Which OS version and glibc version are you using? Based the answers to a similar stackoverflow question, my guess is that you have a glibc version earlier than 2.17, which is needed for the binary distribution to work.
The easiest workaround may be to install a Docker container containing TensorFlow, by following the instructions here.
body:
Which OS version and glibc version are you using? Based the answers to [a similar stackoverflow question](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2418157/ubuntu-linux-c-error-undefined-reference-to-clock-gettime-and-clock-settim), my guess is that you have a glibc version earlier than 2.17, which is needed for the binary distribution to work.

The easiest workaround may be to install a Docker container containing TensorFlow, by following [the instructions here](http://tensorflow.org/get_started/os_setup.md#docker-based_installation).
